definition: mother and child/parent and subsidiary (companies)/principal and interest

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

pinyin: mu3 zi3 chui2 zhi2 gan3 ran3

sentences.english: Psychopathological classifications, which emphasize the mother-child relationships, are essential reference marks.
sentences.chinese: 心理病理学分类，着重于母子关系是必要的参考标准。
奥卡万戈的猎豹母子，博茨瓦纳，1999。

sentences.english: Mother and son left. They walked along the street in silence.
sentences.chinese: 母子俩离开药店，默默地走在街上。

sentences.english: Police did not release the names of the mother and child.
sentences.chinese: 警方没有公布母子俩的姓名。

sentences.english: How close is too close when it comes to mothers and sons?
sentences.chinese: 母子间的亲密到底有没有底线？

sentences.english: The two are intimately connected during the nine months of pregnancy.
sentences.chinese: 在孕期的九个月中母子俩密切相连。

sentences.english: The mother and twins all were doing well though the newborns were both in incubators, the official said.
sentences.chinese: 负责人称新生儿被放在在保育器内，母子都平安。

sentences.english: Now mother and daughter are alloted to nothing but a small waiting room.
sentences.chinese: 现在她们两母子被安排在一间细小的等候室。

sentences.english: It helps cement the strong bond between mother and child.
sentences.chinese: 它有助于建立母子间的亲密关系。

sentences.english: I am a father, I learn a lot from this.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个父亲，我感激这对母子俩，让我学到了许多。

sentences.english: Pretty much all mother-child relationships have some conflict built into them, some more than others.
sentences.chinese: 很多母子存在抵触关系，有一些甚至比这更严重。

sentences.english: In the mother-child relationship, those same two forces apply.
sentences.chinese: 这两种力量在母子关系之间也发挥了效用。

mutually dependent for life (idiom); to rely upon one another for survival/interdependent
